category.algolia.setup.instructions.getS: To get started, follow these steps
category.algolia.setup.instructions.sign: Sign up for a free Algolia account
category.algolia.setup.instructions.getA: Get your API Keys (Settings -> API Keys).
category.algolia.setup.instructions.conf: Configure and populate the new index. For this, you can either:
category.algolia.setup.instructions.foll: Find the instructions in the scripts/README.md file.
category.algolia.setup.instructions.drag: Drag and drop the JSON file that contains the demo products (composable/packages/commerce-generic/src/data/products.json).
category.algolia.setup.instructions.rele: RELEVANCE ESSENTIALS -> Searchable attributes: add the 'name' and 'category' fields.
category.algolia.setup.instructions.face: FILTERING AND FACETING -> Facets: add the 'type', 'brand' and 'price' attributes.
category.algolia.setup.instructions.crea: Create replicas for different sorting options.
category.algolia.setup.instructions.repl: Create 4 replicas, following this naming pattern: {PRIMARY_INDEX_NAME}_{SORTING_OPTION}. The SORTING_OPTION values should be: 'newest', 'priceDesc', 'priceAsc' and 'nameAsc'.

For each replica, configure sorting to match the name of the index. Go to Configuration -> RELEVANCE ESSENTIALS -> Ranking and Sorting, select '+ Add sort-by attribute', type the field name and then select Ascending or Descending sort.
category.algolia.setup.instructions.crea: Note that you can create different sorting options, but you'll have to modify the ALGOLIA_SORTING_OPTIONS constant in the application.
category.algolia.setup.instructions.addE: Finally, add the following environment variables to this application's .env file
